name: UIGestureRecognizerDelegate
desc: A set of methods implemented by the delegate of a gesture recognizer to fine-tune an appâ€™s gesture-recognition behavior.

items.name: func gestureRecognizerShouldBegin(UIGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should begin interpreting touches.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(UIGestureRecognizer, shouldReceive: UITouch) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a touch.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(UIGestureRecognizer, shouldReceive: UIPress) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a press.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(UIGestureRecognizer, shouldReceive: UIEvent) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should receive an object representing a touch or press event.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(UIGestureRecognizer, shouldRecognizeSimultaneouslyWith: UIGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if two gesture recognizers should be allowed to recognize gestures simultaneously.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(UIGestureRecognizer, shouldRequireFailureOf: UIGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should require another gesture recognizer to fail.

items.name: func gestureRecognizer(UIGestureRecognizer, shouldBeRequiredToFailBy: UIGestureRecognizer) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if a gesture recognizer should be required to fail by another gesture recognizer.
